description.value:
You summon a spirit that assumes the form of an unusually intelligent, strong, and loyal steed, creating a long-lasting bond with it. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, this creature uses the Otherworldly Steed stat block. If you already have a steed from this spell, your steed is replaced by the new one.

The steed resembles a Large, rideable animal of your choice, such as a horse, a camel, a dire wolf, or an elk (at your DM's discretion). Whenever you cast the spell, choose the steed's type - Celestial, Fey, or Fiend - which determines certain traits in the stat block.

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.actors.Actor.bwgzqsZclgh3VRWO]{Otherworldly Steed - Celestial}

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.actors.Actor.NdvxP6tYSaK9uxlv]{Otherworldly Steed - Fey}

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.actors.Actor.BeNR35EqNeraLdHN]{Otherworldly Steed - Fiend}

Combat. The steed is an ally to you and your companions, and can be a mount for you or one of your allies. In combat, it functions as a controlled mount (as defined in the Player's Handbook in Chapter 9) and it shares the initiative of whoever is riding it. While controlled the steed can use its action to take the Attack action and its specific bonus action, unlike other controlled mounts. If the creature controlling the mount becomes incapacitated, then it takes its turn immediately after the controller and acts independently, focusing on protecting the rider. If the rider changes during the same initiative then the steed cannot move or take actions until after the new rider's next turn.

Disappearance of the Steed. The steed disappears if it drops to 0 Hit Points, if you dismiss it as a Bonus Action, or if you die. When it disappears, it leaves behind anything it was wearing or carrying. If you cast the spell again, you decide whether you summon the steed that disappeared or a different one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a Spell Slot of 3rd level or higher, use the higher level where the spell's level appears in the stat block.
